intro: Brassica barrelieri var. laevigata, commonly known as the smooth-leaved mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring smooth, glabrous leaves that are alternate and elliptic in shape. Its flowering period occurs in spring, and it is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
